title: Srimad Bhagavatam | HG Chanchalapathi Dasa | SB 3.15.34 | 22-01-2016
speaker: HG Chanchalapathi Dasa

segments.text: Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 3, Chapter 15, Text number 34.
He is stated in Bhagavad Gita, 7th Chapter, Text, Verse 27.
It is stated that, as long as a living entity is pure, he is in complete harmony with the desires of the Supreme Lord.
But as soon as he becomes impure, he is in disharmony with the desires of the Lord.
By contamination, he is forced to transfer to this material world.
Where the living entities have three enemies, namely, desire, anger and lust.
These three enemies force the living entities to continue material existence.
And when one is free from them, he is eligible to enter the kingdom of God.
One should not, therefore, be angry in the absence of an opportunity for sense gratification.
And one should not be lusty to acquire more than necessary.
In this verse, it is clearly stated that the two doormen should be sent into the material world, where criminals are allowed to reside.
Since the basic principles of criminality are sense gratification, anger and unnecessary lust,
persons conducted by these three enemies of the living entity are never promoted to Vaikunthaloka.
People should learn Bhagavad Gita and accept the Supreme.
personality of Godhead Krishna as the Lord of everything, they should practice satisfying
the senses of the Supreme Lord instead of trying to satisfy their own senses. Training
in Krishna consciousness will help one be promoted to Vaikuntha. Thus ends the Bhaktivedanta
purport. So we are seeing in this part of the Bhagavatam, the four Kumaras trying to
enter Vaikuntha and they have been stopped by the two doormen and the sages have become
angry and now they are speaking their angry words. And we are seeing in this part of the
Bhagavatam, in this particular verse, they sort of take an action, what should be done
Manthadhi means intelligence. Manthadhi means they are not acting very intelligently. Manthadhibhyam,
these two. So let us consider, dhimahi, let us consider what should be done. Karatumprakrshtumiha,
we should do something to them that will actually eventually benefit them.
And what do they decide? Lokan itho vrajatam. Let them itaha, from here, in this Vaikuntha.
Lokan vrajatam, let them go, go away from here. Lokan itho vrajatam.
Because, antharabhava drishtya, they have developed a vision of antharabhava. They have,
the Lord has one bhava, but they have developed an antharabhava. So, they have developed this
kind of antharabhava drishtya. So they should not be here.
Lokan itho vrajatam. They should go away from here. Where should they go? Paapi asas,
place where paapi asa, paapis, sinful, wicked people, go. And where? Traya ime ripavo asya
yatra. Ripaha, ripavaha, is enemies. Traya ime ripavaha, ripavaha, is enemies. Traya ime
ripavaha, traya ripavaha, where people in this material world, let them go to this material
world, where paapi asaha, sinful people live with three enemies. Ripavaha, traya ripavaha,
let them live there, let them go to the place where living entities live with three enemies.
Therefore let us consider, dhimahi, how these two contaminated persons, mandadhibhyam, should
be punished. Kartum prakristam. The punishment should be apt. For thus, benefit can eventually
be bestowed upon them. Prakrshtam ehah! Since they find duality in the existence in vaikunta
They are contaminated, mandadhibhyam, and should be removed from this place, vrajatam, to the material world, lokan, itho vrajatam, where living entities have three kinds of enemies,
traya ime ripavo asya yatra ha. So Srila Prabhupada has mentioned some very significant things in the purport. This is an example of two perfected living entities in the spiritual world,

which is the purport of the material world, is because of the purport of the material world.
